item.title: Food, our first medicine?
item.dc:creator: Yappo
item.description:
What is the common point between diabetes, cardiovascular disorders, hypertension, osteoporosis, depression, overweight, burnout, stress, hypercholesterolemia or degenerative disorders? They are all directly related to the quality of the diet and the practice of regular physical activity. Indeed, without adequate food and sufficient solicitation of our cells, your body can not maintain its homeostasis. ” We are […]

item.title: Nutrition and liver detoxification: info or intox?
item.dc:creator: Yappo
item.description:
In our body the liver is the main organ responsible for detoxification, and its activity is adapted to the amount of xenobiotics brought to it. These xenobiotics are molecules foreign to our body such as drugs, hormones, heavy metals, but also the chemical compounds associated with the preparation of food (such as the famous Maillard body). The liver is […]

item.title: Bariatric surgery
item.dc:creator: Yappo
item.description:
What are the nutritional consequences of bariatric surgery? In the face of the global challenges of obesity and the relative failures of diets, more and more people are resorting to obesity surgery, also called bariatric surgery. 102,000 procedures were performed in Europe in 2014, nearly 47,000 in France including 13,879 gastric bypass, 27,761 sleeve and 4,533 […]

item.description:
If there is a nutrient attributed to the muscles, it is the proteins. And indeed, it is a major constituent of muscle tissue, whose contributions deserve to be optimized daily when you are interested in sports, when you want to lose weight or just take care of your health . The thinning and the regular practice of […]

A global food issue The current evolution of the world’s population correlated with the increasing consumption of animal proteins puts the population face a nutritional and ecological stalemate. To […]

item.title: Polyamines, cancer and chronic pain: what links?
item.dc:creator: Yappo
item.description:
Polyamines, cancer and chronic pain, therapeutic tracks still little explored   Behind this technical term lies a family of molecules essential to life. Primarily three in number – putrescine, spermidine, spermine – they are closely involved in cell division and proliferation processes. Some studies thus highlight their potential links in the development of cancer and more recently […]

item.title: Should we eat gluten-free?
item.dc:creator: Yappo
item.description:
Particularly publicized in recent years, gluten-free diet is in vogue, including in the sports world. His interest has been highlighted for over 30 years by Dr. Kousmine. The reasons for the adoption of this regime, not to say a way of life, remain unclear to many. We practice the gluten-free diet because we suffer from digestive disorders, allergies, […]

item.title: Is it good to fast? Can we fast and play sports?
item.dc:creator: Yappo
item.description:
Historically practiced for reasons of a religious or therapeutic nature, fasting has been highlighted for a few years for its effects on well-being, including in sports circles. But the mere mention of the word “fasting” can cool more than one, as it refers to the concept of restriction: it is characterized by a period of deprivation […]
